title: A Day Without Immigrants

organizations.name: getty images none mexican association of perth amboy

text: Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email A Day Without Immigrants Andres Mijares, left, and Joseph Cruz, right, join others during a march and rally during an immigration protest, on Feb. 16, 2017, in Austin, Texas. Immigrants around the U.S. stayed home from work and school Thursday to demonstrate how important they are to America's economy and way of life, and many businesses closed in solidarity, in a nationwide protest called "A Day Without" Immigrants. Post to Facebook A Day Without Immigrants Andres Mijares, left, and Joseph Cruz, right, join others during a march and rally during an immigration protest, on Feb. 16, 2017, in Austin, Texas. Immigrants around the U.S. stayed home from work and school Thursday to demonstrate how important they are to America's economy and way of life, and many businesses closed in solidarity, in a nationwide protest called "A Day Without" Immigrants. A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 14 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs A Day Without Immigrants None Andres Mijares, left, and Joseph Cruz, right, join others during a march and rally during an immigration protest, on Feb. 16, 2017, in Austin, Texas. Immigrants around the U.S. stayed home from work and school Thursday to demonstrate how important they are to America's economy and way of life, and many businesses closed in solidarity, in a nationwide protest called "A Day Without" Immigrants. Eric Gay, AP Supporters of immigrants' rights march downtown Washington, D.C., during an immigration protest on Thursday. Jose Luis Magana, AP None Mary Rudamas, the owner of restaurant that specializes in El Salvadoran food, poses for a photo in Phoenix, Ariz., on Thursday. Rudamas, an immigrant from El Salvador, who supports immigrants, couldn't manage to close because it was too busy but gave the day off to two employees who requested it. Astrid Galvan, AP None A large crowd of "A Day Without Immigrants," participants filled much of the inside of the Minnesota State Capitol on Thursday, in St. Paul, Minn. David Joles, AP None Protesters participate in a march aimed squarely at President Donald Trump's efforts to crack down on immigration, Thursday, in Chicago. Charles Rex Arbogast, AP None A sign in support of "A Day Without Immigrants" is displayed in a closed business in the East Boston neighborhood of Boston, Thursday. Michael Dwyer, AP Supporters of immigrants' rights march downtown Washington during an immigration protest on Thursday. Jose Luis Magana, AP None Eva Marquez, 6, waves the flag of Mexico,Thursday, while riding on her father Marco's shoulders during a protest for a +Day Without Immigrants" protest. Evan Frost, AP Supporters of immigrants' rights march downtown in Washington, D.C., on Thursday. Jose Luis Magana, AP None A customer who asked not to be identified reads a sign at Rancho Markets in Salt Lake City, one of many businesses in Utah and around the country that closed Feb. 16. 2017 for the "A Day Without Immigrants" strike to support immigrants and emphasize their contributions to workplaces and society. Lennie Mahler, AP None Protesters march in the streets outside the Texas State Capital on 'A Day Without Immigrants' on Thursday, in Austin, Texas. The crowd, which grew to well over a thousand participants, marched from the Austin City Hall to the Texas State Capital. Across the country hundreds of restaurants and eateries are closing for the day to protest President Trump's immigration policies and to highlight the contributions of immigrants to U.S. business and life. Drew Anthony Smith, Getty Images None Mexican Association of Perth Amboy members, from left, Alicia Ireneo, Leonardo Sanchez and Rodolfo Cortes, carry flags while walking in front of closed business taking part of an immigration protest, Thursday, in Perth Amboy, N.J. Julio Cortez, AP None A woman participates in a rally to show support for 'A Day Without Immigrants', in Washington, DC,. Michael Reynolds, EPA None People participate in a march and rally to show support for 'A Day Without Immigrants' in Washington, DC. Michael Reynolds, EPA None Protesters march in the streets outside the Texas State Capital on 'A Day Without Immigrants,' Thursday, in Austin, Texas. Drew Anthony Smith, Getty Images None Olivia Vazquez, a community organizer with Juntos, speaks to the Associated Press Thursday, in south Philadelphia's Italian Market. In an action called "A Day Without Immigrants", immigrants across the country are expected to stay home from school and work on Thursday to show how critical they are to the U.S. economy and way of life. Jacqueline Larma, AP None A man holds a sign depicting President Donald J. Trump wearing a swastika armband during a march and rally outside the Wilson Building, to show support for 'A Day Without Immigrants', in Washington, DC, on Thursday. Michael Reynolds, EPA None Luis Arce Mota, the chef and co-owner of La Contenta, talks about his decision to close his restaurant for the day, on Feb. 16, 2017, in New York. Mota, from Mexico, is now a U.S. citizen. Mark Lennihan, AP None Several dozen area residents marched down Broadway Avenue in Pittsburgh's Beechview Ave. on Thursday, protesting the recent crackdowns on immigrants ordered by President Donald Trump. "Day Without Immigrants" protests are being held across the United States. Nate Guidry, Pittsburgh Post-Gazette via AP None A sign in the window of the popular Brooklyn restaurant Prime Meats explains their solidarity with the "A Day Without Immigrants," boycott/strike on Thursday. Spencer Platt, Getty Images None People past Prime Meats restaurant which stands closed in solidarity with the "A Day Without Immigrants." Spencer Platt, Getty Images None After attempting to enter, Kristina Roth of Colorado Springs, Colorado, stops to take a picture of a sign on the door of the restaurant 'Oyamel Cocina Mexicana', which states it is closed in solidarity with 'A Day Without Immigrants', in Washington, DC. MICHAEL REYNOLDS, EPA None An man attempts to enter the restaurant 'Zaytinya,' owned by chef Jose Andres, on Thursday, discovering that it is closed in solidarity with 'A Day Without Immigrants,' in Washington, DC. Michael Reynolds, EPA None Luis Arce Mota, the chef and co-owner of La Contenta, posts a flyer in the window announcing the closure of his restaurant for the day, Thursday, in New York. Mark Lennihan, AP None High school senior Vicky Sosa protests outside the Grayson County courthouse in Sherman, Texas. Today is called "A Day Without Immigrants," as immigrants across the country stayed home from school, work and close businesses to show how critical they are to the U.S. economy and way of life. LM Otero, AP A mail carrier passes a closed bakery in South Philadelphia's Italian Market. Jacqueline Larma, AP None Counter-protester Todd Johnson, right, holds a sign as Luis Perez confronts him with his own sign during a protest outside the Grayson County courthouse in Sherman, Texas. LM Otero, AP None High school student Kathia Suarez holds up a sign as she protests with others outside the Grayson County courthouse in downtown Sherman, Texas. LM Otero, AP None Hundreds of people march along W. Vernor Highway. in Detroit during the "A Day Without Immigrants" rally Feb. 16, 2017. Ryan Garza/Detroit Free Press None A shopper walks past a sign hanging outside the closed Marco's Fish Market in South Philadelphia's Italian Market. Jacqueline Larma, AP Remigio Galicia of Passaic, N.J., walks in Passaic where several businesses are closed. The (Bergen County, N.J.) Record Like this topic?
